title: âš ï¸ FW: RS485/Modbus data invalid (all zeros), sporadic malformed frames, long BOOT state
body:
## ğŸ” Summary
Firmware RS485/Modbus comms appear electrically OK (CRC valid, ~96% transport success), but many registers return all-zero payloads; some responses are malformed (Slave=0x00/Func=0x00); occasional timeouts; and system remains in BOOT for a long time. This leads to repeated `Data validation failed` across modules.

## ğŸ“œ Evidence (from logs)
- Success path:
  - TX: `02 03 00 30 00 08 44 30` â†’ RX: `02 03 10 00 00 ... 00 A0 1D` (CRC OK) but values all 0
  - Similar for 0x0041, 0x001C, 0x0040, 0x0049, 0x0010 on slaves 0x02/0x04
- Malformed/short frames:
  - RX short/rubbish: `00 00 0B 7A`, `00 00 00 8B FF` (Slave=0x00/Func=0x00)
- Exceptions:
  - Slaves 0x06/0x07: `06 83 02 ...` `07 83 02 ...` â†’ ILLEGAL_DATA_ADDRESS
- Timeouts: intermittent (status=-4)
- State machine: `STATE BOOT timeout` (system not READY)
- COMM_HEALTH transport success ~96%, but semantic data invalid (all zeros).

## ğŸ¯ Impact
- Telemetry/diagnostics unreliable
- Control/safety decisions blocked (system not READY)
- Backend receives transport success but invalid semantic data

## ğŸ§­ Likely Root Causes
1. Module state not READY (still BOOT) â†’ registers return 0
2. Register map mismatch (addresses/qty/endian) for modules 0x02/0x04
3. RS485 timing: DE/RE turnaround / inter-frame gap too short â†’ occasional malformed/short frames
4. Bus integrity: termination/bias/ground/shield
5. Polling non-existent modules 0x06/0x07 â†’ exception 0x83/0x02

## âœ… Action Items (Proposed Fix Plan)
1) Initialization & State
- Ensure init-sequence completes and stateâ†’READY < 10s before polling.
- Gate polling by discovery; skip polling modules not present.

2) Register Map Validation
- Re-validate addresses/quantities for 0x02 (Power) and 0x04 (Motor).
- Start with small reads (2â€“4 regs), confirm endian/scales, then expand.

3) RS485 Timing & Robustness
- Set silent interval â‰¥ 3.5 chars; TXâ†’RX turnaround â‰¥ 1â€“2 ms (per baud).
- Add inter-request backoff 50â†’150 ms with jitter.
- Keep retries=3, but downgrade rate when invalid data repeats.

4) Bus Hardware Checklist
- Verify 120Î© termination, bias resistors, shield/ground continuity, connectors.
- Check cable length/load and routing away from noise.

5) Error Handling & Health Metrics
- Treat CRC-OK but all-zero payload as invalid semantic data (donâ€™t count as full success).
- Separate metrics: transport_success vs value_valid_rate.
- For ILLEGAL_DATA_ADDRESS, suppress repeated logs and skip that register.

6) WebSocket (FYI)
- WS firmware connects/disconnects periodically; confirm heartbeat/keepalive but not blocking RS485.

## ğŸ“ Acceptance Criteria
- State transitions to READY in < 10s.
- No malformed frames (no Slave=0x00/Func=0x00).
- p95 timeout â‰ˆ 0 in steady state.
- Power (0x02) & Motor (0x04) readings non-zero and pass validator.
- No polling of non-existent modules (0x06/0x07) unless discovered.
- COMM_HEALTH: transport_success â‰¥ 99%, value_valid_rate â‰¥ 98%.

## ğŸ”§ Suggested Changes (Code)
- Increase inter-frame delay and turnaround in HAL RS485 driver.
- Add READY gate + discovery before polling in polling manager.
- Refactor register map constants; add unit tests for packing/unpacking.
- Improve parser to reject all-zero frames as invalid for specific register groups.

## ğŸ“ Attachments
- Snippets included above; full logs available on request.

/cc @backend @firmware @embed â€” needs FW ownership to implement timing, state gating, and register map validation.
